=== Comments ===

Day 1 was GREAT!!!
We had nearly finished setting up shop and already two people came to us saying they ran Ubuntu at home! During the day, we've had dozens of people coming by and saying they used Ubuntu. Sometimes they asked questions when they couldn't get something to work and when we could we helped them or else referred them to our extensive Wiki's and our forum. We were really quite amazed that there are THAT many Ubuntu-users out there.
The pressed CD's (Edgy Eft, Dapper Drake) were gone like tissues at a snot party before we knew it. We didn't hand them out, though, we waited for the people to actually ask us about them. A lot of people were aware of the existence of "Live-technology", which made explaining it all a lot easier.

Throughout the day we kept answering their questions and we're sure that we're responsible for a lot of new members now. I personally heard the words "because it's not Microsoft" quite a lot of times.

In the afternoon, there was one booth that felt necessary to preview Vista (while selling Linux Mandriva), Ubuntu and Mandriva. I wasn't there, but it appears that Vista actually crashed during the presentation.
Way to go!

Sometime in the afternoon, we also found a booth that was actually selling Ubuntu CD's (self-burned) for â‚¬ 10 each. We felt compelled to ask him about this, but there wasn't really anything we could do. After all, he's not asking for money for the operating system, but for the disc it's on, really.

  There is no restriction on selling the Ubuntu operating system; if someone wants to pay you 1 million for a copy of Ubuntu, just take the money (and donate some of it to Ubuntu-be of course ;) ). -- JanClaeys
